sections.name: Science – Physics
sections.description: Questions based on Class 10 NCERT topics: Light, Electricity and Magnetic Effects of Current.

questions.question: Which mirror always forms a virtual, erect and diminished image of an object placed in front of it?
According to the law of reflection, the angle of incidence is equal to the angle of __________.
The SI unit of electric current is:
In a series circuit, the current flowing through each resistor is:
Fleming’s Left-Hand Rule is used to find the direction of:
If the magnification produced by a mirror is positive, the image formed is:
The electrical power consumed by an appliance is given by the expression P = __________.

sections.name: Science – Chemistry
sections.description: MCQs covering Chemical Reactions, Acids-Bases-Salts, Metals & Non-metals, and Carbon Compounds.

questions.question: Which type of chemical reaction is represented by 2KClO₃ → 2KCl + 3O₂?
The pH value of a neutral solution at 25 °C is:
Which of the following is NOT an ore of iron?
Which gas is produced when zinc reacts with dilute hydrochloric acid?
In the reactivity series of metals, the most reactive metal among the following is:
The functional group present in ethanol is:
Which salt is commonly known as baking soda?
The reaction of an acid with a base to form salt and water is called:
Which allotrope of carbon is a good lubricant due to its layered structure?

sections.name: Science – Biology
sections.description: MCQs from Life Processes, Control & Coordination, Reproduction, Heredity & Evolution, and Environment.

questions.question: The process by which green plants prepare their own food is called:
Which blood vessel carries blood from the heart to the lungs for oxygenation?
Iodine solution is used to test the presence of __________ in leaves.
Which hormone is responsible for lowering blood glucose levels?
In human females, the site of fertilisation is usually the:
Mendel’s law of segregation is based on separation of alleles during formation of:
The gradual change in the inherited traits of a population over generations is called:
Excessive use of fertilisers and pesticides in agriculture leads primarily to:
Which of the following is a renewable, inexhaustible source of energy?

sections.name: Mathematics
sections.description: 25 MCQs covering Number Systems, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Mensuration, and Statistics & Probability.

questions.question: The decimal expansion of 7/8 terminates after how many decimal places?
If the discriminant of a quadratic equation is zero, the roots are:
The coefficient of x² in the expansion of (x + 3)² is:
For the linear pair of equations 3x + 2y = 6 and 6x + 4y = 12, the system is:
Distance between points (1, 2) and (4, 6) in the coordinate plane is:
In ∆ABC, if ∠A = 90°, then the side opposite ∠A is called:
The value of sin 30° is:
If tan θ = 1, then θ equals:
Circumference of a circle with radius 7 cm is:
Area of a square having diagonal 10 cm is:
A cube has volume 125 cm³. Its surface area is:
Mean of the data 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 is:
In probability, the sum of probabilities of all elementary events of an experiment is:
If two lines are perpendicular, the product of their slopes is:
The roots of x² – 5x + 6 = 0 are:
Mode of the data set 3, 3, 5, 6, 6, 6, 7, 8 is:
The probability of getting a head when a fair coin is tossed once is:
Volume of a right circular cone is $\frac{1}{3} \pi r^2 h$. If r = 3 cm and h = 5 cm, volume equals:
In an AP, the common difference is found by:
Sum of the first n natural numbers is:
If sec θ = 13/12, then cos θ is:
The coordinates of the midpoint of the line joining (–2, 4) and (4, –6) are:
If a chord of a circle subtends a right angle at the centre, the chord is:
choices: Greater than radius but less than diameter
questions.answer: Greater than radius but less than diameter

questions.question: The standard deviation is a measure of:
If two dice are thrown simultaneously, the total number of possible outcomes is:
